import Mathlib

/-!
Suppose f : I â†’ â„ is differentiable at c âˆˆ I. Then there exist real numbers a and b such that
for every Îµ>0 there exists Î´>0 with |a + b(x-c) - f(x)| â‰¤ Îµ|x-c| whenever xâˆˆI and |x-c|<Î´.
Equivalently, there exists g with lim_{xâ†’c} g(x)=0 and |a + b(x-c) - f(x)| = |x-c| g(x) for x near c.
-/-

theorem differentiable_within_at.exists_linear_approx {f : â„ â†’ â„} {s : Set â„} {c : â„}
  (h : DifferentiableWithinAt â„ f s c) :
  âˆƒ a b : â„, âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ Î´ > 0, âˆ€ x, x âˆˆ s â†’ |x - c| < Î´ â†’ |a + b * (x - c) - f x| â‰¤ Îµ * |x - c| := by
  sorry
